item.title: C++/Java programmers guide to building and running bigger projects w/ GNU Make
item.description: First learning C++ in university, I thought compiling and running C++ programs was just about as easy Python. All I needed was a compiler (GNU g++ would do just fine) and then I could just run the produced executable. Granted that was one more step than just having a simple Python module interpreted, but it was easy enough running this command in a terminal: -- > g++ main.cpp -o out && .
